channel.title: Posts on Malware Analysis: Or How I Learned To Love Frustration
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Malware Analysis: Or How I Learned To Love Frustration

item.title: An Introduction
item.description: Purpose> Purpose # I’ve started this blog with the express purpose of documenting my progress of learning to reverse engineer malware. My primary focus will be on analysing increasingly difficult malware strands, observed in the wild from various sources with a dash of the solutions to various RE CTFs that pop up now and then. Perhaps most importantly, I aim to document the key lessons that I have learned throughout my journey, the hardships and failures that I encountered prior to documenting my successful analysis of each piece of malware – afterall, reverse engineering is a journey of “how to find your zen” when all you want to do is scream and set Windows on fire aka how to cope with constant failure.
